plants.name: Cilantro
plants.description: Cilantro is an herb that grows best in full sun and well drained soil, but they can take some shade, especially in warmer climates. Cilantro requires about an inch of water per week.

plants.name: Lemon
plants.description: Citrus plants prefer warmer climates with full to partial sun and can grow in almost any soil with good drainage. They need daily watering when newly planted, but can sustain watering only once or twice a week once matured.

plants.name: Rosemary
plants.description: Rosemary is an herb that grows best in full sun and well drained soil. This herb takes regular watering until it is established and can then take less frequent watering.

plants.name: Basil
plants.description: Basil is a tropical herb that grows best in full sun and well drained soil and requires about an inch of water per week. Basil grown in containers may need more frequent watering.

plants.name: Thyme
plants.description: Thyme is an herb that grows best in full sun and well drained soil. Can be grown in pots but will flourish in gardens. Thyme can thrive in colder months and requires little watering.

plants.name: Lettuce
plants.description: Lettuce is a cool weather crop and is best grown in spring and fall. It grows best in loose soil with good drainage and requires water about twice a week. An average level of sunlight will suffice.

plants.name: Bell Pepper
plants.description: Bell peppers are warm weather crops that require lots of sun. If temperatures are high, they may need some shade during the day and need about about one to two inches of water per week.

plants.name: Onion
plants.description: Onions are best cultivated in fertile soils that are well-drained and require full to partial sun. In suitable climates, onions need about an inch of water per week

plants.name: Celery
plants.description: Celery requires rich soil, plenty of water, and protection from hot sun and high temperatures. Grow celery as a winter crop in the South, a summer crop in the far North, and a fall crop in most other areas.

plants.name: Carrot
plants.description: Carrots prefer full sun but relatively cool soil. They can grow in light shade and are great in gardens. If rainfall is scarce, you will need to water the soil completely.

plants.name: Potato
plants.description: Potatoes grow best in cool, well-drained, loose soil. They require full sun and need between 1-2 inches of water per week.

plants.name: Garlic
plants.description: Garlic is easy to grow and can be grown year-round in mild climates. In colder climates, cloves are best planted about six weeks before the soil freezes. Harvest is in late spring or early summer.

plants.name: Air Plant
plants.description: Air plants are tropical plants that absorb moisture through their leaves. They can be grown indoors if adequite humidity and indirect sunlight is provided. Air plants only need to be watered about once per week.

plants.name: Orange
plants.description: Citrus plants prefer warmer climates with full to partial sun and can grow in almost any soil with good drainage. They need daily watering when newly planted, but can sustain watering only once or twice a week once matured.

plants.name: Tomato
plants.description: Tomatoes grow well in well-drained soil and require full sun exposure. Tomatoes can grow well both in pots and in the ground. Harvest once red appears on the skin of the tomato.
